title: ‘How can replacement battery for my Dyson vacuum cost twice as much as a brand new one?’
text:
Has a company treated you unfairly? Our consumer champion, Katie Morley, is here to help. For how to contact her click here.

Dear Katie,

My Dyson V8 Animal vacuum cleaner has packed up after three years. The battery cuts out within 40 seconds.

I wrote to customer services to inquire about a replacement battery. I was told it would cost £770. The cost of a new V8 Animal is £350 and that includes many attachments, none of which I require. The only part I need is the battery.

I should have thought that a company of the size and reputation of Dyson would want to offer a reasonable replacement? A battery life of three years is unacceptable. It has offered no apology. Dyson should be ashamed.

...
